intro: Centropogon flos-mutisii, commonly known as the Mutis's flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that are often adorned with contrasting yellow markings. It thrives in high-altitude environments, typically in moist, shaded areas within cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
